channel.title: The golden age of PC gaming - classic games
channel.description:
There must be a thread for those forgotten pearls, such as Blake Stone: Planet Strike, Dark Forces or Commander Keen. These games were in many ways better than today's stars.
There are ones, which were popular at their release, but as time passed, people forgot them, and now are pop again, like Half-life and the upcoming remake, Black Mesa.
Lets talk about this wonders of mankind.

item.title: The golden age of PC gaming - classic games
item.dc:creator: gorr35
item.description:
Anything made by Sierra Studios back in the 90’s…The Leisure Suit Larry series , Phantasmagoria , Gabriel Knight , Kings Quest series , Swat , Lighthouse…all great games. I would love to see a remake of Lighthouse and Shivers!

Read full topic
item.source: The golden age of PC gaming - classic games

item.title: The golden age of PC gaming - classic games
item.dc:creator: vand3537
item.description:
System Shock 2, the G.o.a.T.

by some amazing stroke of luck, SS2, Half life, and Deus Ex were the first 3 PC video games I ever played (aside from sports games, and some X-wing game that was actually pretty bad ass) and most games since have been a disappointment

I think 2 N64 games also require a shout out: Perfect Dark and MK Mythologies: Sub Zero.

ah the good old days

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
Gasp! You haven’t been lucky enough to behold. There’s few things that can beat seeing a dog suddenly go flying through the air like a plane, landing on his victim delivering a bite that sends up a mushroom cloud, then immediately soaring through the air to his next victim.

item.description:

Nope, sorry, it’s Red Alert. MODIFIED Red Alert, where you can train civilians with superweapons and ore trucks have 120mm cannons and dogs can jump almost entirely across even the largest maps in a single bound and murder people with nuclear bites.

What the hell are you talking about, your post had not one shred of sense.

item.title: The golden age of PC gaming - classic games
item.dc:creator: iPwn
item.description:
ac3d:

Same, did you know about the levitating trick? Talespin and Jump at the same time and then Tailspin again at just before Croc starts to fall, and you can hover around in the air for a good 3 seconds, it makes the later levels in the retail version way easier

Oh shit man. i did it once by accident. after i saw it i was like “wat”. but then i profited from it

Read full topic
item.source: The golden age of PC gaming - classic games

item.title: The golden age of PC gaming - classic games
item.dc:creator: Twyzer
item.description:
ac3d:

Krusty’s Funhouse? only clown game that comes to mind

No, not that. I remember the clown I’m talking about was built from spheres. His hair was 3 white spheres in both sides, and he could shoot spheres to the enemies. Also, there was a map, where everything was black (a cave maybe), and you could see things only in the 3 meter radius of the clown. There were even game-in-the-game minigames, where you have to play with some kinda arcade machine in-game.

I found no pics from it and I dont know its title. I found it in a 101-games pack, and was probably for win95.

Probably its name was Dr xyz or Mr xyz, or Xyz the clown.

Read full topic
item.source: The golden age of PC gaming - classic games

Krusty’s Funhouse? only clown game that comes to mind

item.dc:creator: ac3d
item.description:
iPwn:

Oh man. i played that croc demo over and over and over again…

Same, did you know about the levitating trick? Talespin and Jump at the same time and then Tailspin again at just before Croc starts to fall, and you can hover around in the air for a good 3 seconds, it makes the later levels in the retail version way easier

item.description:
Ham Solo:


Shadows fo the Empire, I was replaying the hoth level countless times.


Thief

I love this thread so FUCKING MUCH

also.

GOOD OLE LOOKIN’ GLASS

Oh ! yes and for the “Rampage”, i remember getting kicked out of the arcade once, i started slamming the screen with a magazine because i ran out of credits. i was like 6 years old man… that’s a rampage alright.
